b'RT @namjaanu: @coldplay @RavesGrave Amsterdam today :)\xf0\x9f\x92\x9c #MOTSpics #mots https://t.co/MXqD2hTVID'

b'If you missed last night\xe2\x80\x99s tweet along to #MusicOfTheSpheres, you can replay all the tweets while listening to the album over on the #TimsTwitterListeningParty website now. \n\nhttps://t.co/EioGyEyaT3'

b'Thanks for listening along with us everyone. Really enjoyed that. And a big shoutout to @Tim_Burgess for having us (his band @thecharlatans are a group I\xe2\x80\x99ve loved since I was a kid and you should check them out if you haven\xe2\x80\x99t). Jonny #timstwitterlisteningparty #musicofthespheres'
b"Coloratura's probably my favourite song ever to play live. There\xe2\x80\x99s so many bits. You can just exist in the song. You lose yourself in it. Jonny  #timstwitterlisteningparty"

b'We\xe2\x80\x99d never really talked about doing such a long song before. It\xe2\x80\x99s the longest we\xe2\x80\x99ve ever done. But it really does feel like the right song to end the album on. Guy \n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #MusicOfTheSpheres'
b'And then on the visual side, we had Pilar and V\xc3\xadctor, and the ineffable Dave Meyers. How did we get so lucky? Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty #MusicOfTheSpheres'

b'One of the things I love most about this record is who we got to make it with.  I loved working with Max - brilliantly supported by Oscar and Bill. Michael Ilbert (engineer) was a sonic perfectionist and a lovely, calming influence. Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'I really loved Coloratura before it got extended. It was my favourite song so I was a bit scared about changing it when Chris came back with this idea for the song going off in lots of different directions. But we just decided to go with it and follow where it took us. Jonny'

b"That was something we really started on Viva La Vida, and have kind of maintained for each album ever since. That's what led to the alien planets and languages on this album. Guy #TimsTwitterListeningParty #MusicOfTheSpheres"

b'I think for us the process of creating an album is always set in a kind of a predetermined visual landscape that we\xe2\x80\x99ve created - a world - it just helps give us a framework into which we work musically\xe2\x80\xa6'

b'\xe2\x99\xbe\xef\xb8\x8f features the largest choir we have ever worked with\xe2\x80\xa6 the recording is based around a stadium show  \xe2\x80\x98ol\xc3\xa9 ol\xc3\xa9 ol\xc3\xa9\xe2\x80\x99 chant.  It attempts to imagine what a festival on another planet might sound like - Galaxtonbury\xc2\xa9\xef\xb8\x8f\xc2\xae\xef\xb8\x8f\xe2\x84\xa2\xef\xb8\x8f\xe2\x80\xa6?! Will #TimsTwitterListeningParty\n#MusicOfTheSpheres'

b'All 7 of their voices blend so well together, and with Chris\xe2\x80\x99. This is me and my three boys\xe2\x80\x99 favourite song. \xf0\x9f\x92\x9c Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty #MusicOfTheSpheres'

b'It was one of those brilliant moments I\xe2\x80\x99ll always remember. The band fleshed it out together and then Chris went to Seoul for 48 hours (most of the time in a quarantine hotel). RM did an amazing job with the Korean lyrics, and SUGA and j-hope totally nailed the breakdown. Phil'

b'About 18 months ago, I mentioned to Chris that some members of @BTS_twt had said they were into our band, and I\xe2\x80\x99d heard a rumour they might like to collaborate.  4 months later he called me super-excited - \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99ve got the song for BTS!\xe2\x80\x99 - and played the demo over the phone. Phil'
b'We ran his voice backwards and through a few filters, and added a rapturous alien festival crowd. Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'At the height of covid restrictions, we were recording in the same hotel where Chris and I were staying. Chris asked the doorman to introduce Supernova 7 at the Music Of The Spheres festival for \xf0\x9f\x8c\x8e. Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'We were in Benny from Abba\xe2\x80\x99s studio which was incredible and really inspiring and we just got so much done and had a really lovely time. Jonny #timstwitterlisteningparty'

b'Part of Biutyful was recorded in Sweden in July 2020. That was one of the most magical recording sessions we\xe2\x80\x99ve ever had. It was such a strange time with everywhere in lockdown but we just had so much fun recording. Jonny #timstwitterlisteningparty #musicofthespheres'

b'Biutyful arrived when I was playing with different vocal sounds.  We started working on it in the Everyday Life sessions, but we needed Max and Oscar to finish it.  Chris  #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'\xe2\x80\xa6and so that always ends up helping to define the style of songs that go on an album. So with MOTS there\xe2\x80\x99s some bigger, more anthemic songs which we felt might sound good in a stadium. Guy #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'For Everyday Life we didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel like we wanted to go back on tour yet, so we felt like that was an opportunity to make an album which was slightly more organic, slightly quieter. But we always knew after Everyday Life that we would be thinking about another tour\xe2\x80\xa6'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s definitely the heaviest song we\xe2\x80\x99ve ever done. I think we were looking to make the song sound as intense as possible. Like a really concentrated guitar sound. Ironically quite a lot of the guitar was recorded on an acoustic. Jonny #timstwitterlisteningparty'

b'Chris had the idea for the People Of The Pride verse when we were recording Viva La Vida, so it\xe2\x80\x99s been knocking around since then. It\xe2\x80\x99s been an idea looking for a song. Jonny #timstwitterlisteningparty'

b'This is Will\xe2\x80\x99s favourite song on the album. It only became great once Jacob, Paris and Amber joined. It\xe2\x80\x99s so fun singing with them. All four of us are performing it on the Late Late Show on Wednesday. Chris\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'\xe2\x9d\xa4\xef\xb8\x8f'

b'When Selena performed Let Somebody Go with us on the Late Late Show I was so struck by her effortless charisma. I really love this song, particularly the explosive middle. Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'Chris and I in particular have been big @selenagomez  fans for the longest time. She has such a unique, evocative, mysterious voice. Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty #MusicOfTheSpheres'

b'\xe2\x9c\xa8 is a great moment in the record:  @Jon_Hopkins_ helped us create a \xe2\x80\x99tail\xe2\x80\x99 at the end of Humankind which sounded like the song being sucked into a black hole and then we emerge in to the calm on the other side\xe2\x80\xa6 thanks Jon. Will #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'I think it was really important when we were auditioning songs to let Max hear them in the early stages, to comment and to help guide the actual selection of the songs and which ones he felt were the ones which were worth focusing on. Guy #TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'It\xe2\x80\x99s like our tribute to Van Halen being played by New Order. Jonny #timstwitterlisteningparty'

b'Humankind was probably the hardest song to record on the album, just because we couldn\xe2\x80\x99t quite get the feel of it right until the end of the sessions. And then suddenly it all clicked into place and now we\xe2\x80\x99re really excited to play it live. Jonny #timstwitterlisteningparty'

b'Five days before release, we didn\xe2\x80\x99t have a video so we shot that \xe2\x80\x98extraterrestrial transmission\xe2\x80\x99 in a London car park. Then we beamed it up to space! Not quite sure how that all happened\xe2\x80\xa6. Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'Higher Power was one of the first demos that chris presented.  We recorded most of it on the first day with Max. I love how Jonny steals the show in the last third. Phil #TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'It features the wonderful Love Choir whose vocals provide so much drive and energy. Will #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'Higher Power was the first \xe2\x80\x98foundation stone\xe2\x80\x99 of the record: It was the song that seemed to arrive in its most complete form and it provided something solid to build the rest of the album around. Will\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'It\xe2\x80\x99s just been a really fantastic partnership to join forces creatively with Max. Guy\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'\xf0\x9f\xaa\x90 We were working on the album during the pandemic so we had to adapt like everyone else to the conditions and the travel, but I think the story of this album is our partnership with Max Martin, who produced it. Guy \n#TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'Our co-producer - the mighty Bill Rahko - used a speak & spell toy to create the opening words \xe2\x80\x98Music Of The Spheres\xe2\x80\x99. Chris\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'Hello everyone. Thanks for tuning in to listen to #MusicOfTheSpheres with us. Are you ready? Press play on the album in three\xe2\x80\xa6 two\xe2\x80\xa6 one\xe2\x80\xa6 \nWill \n#TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/67lEFo2m84'

b"2/2 @debswild @_FiercePanda @jowhiley @estwilki Ken Nelson, Markus Dravs, Caroline Elleray, Dan Keeling .. + loads more, all ESSENTIAL to the band's story and success, but we just didn't have time to show everything that happened. b"1/2 We had to leave out so many CRUCIAL people and events. b"It's just two weeks until the A Head Full Of Dreams documentary film shows in thousands of cinemas across the planet (Mongolia just added!). Where will you be watching? Find your local screening at https://t.co/PYRJcEcSZF. A #AHFODfilm https://t.co/hwE2VweAyo"
b"Right, I've got to run.  Thanks so much for all your questions.  Sorry I couldn't answer all of them. Can't wait for you all to see #AHFODfilm.  This was a lot of fun - same time next week? PH"
b'I just feel more grateful than ever to have these five amazing human beings - Chris, Guy, Will, Jonny and Dave - as my brothers in life and music.  PH https://t.co/eU56SYRf6a'
b'So many more surprises to come...  the next few years are going to be a lot of fun PH https://t.co/xsbNmClpky'

b"I think you might be right.  He never likes to look back, he's always looking forwards.  But I think it's nice to glance over your shoulder sometimes, even if just to remind yourself that anything is possible. PH https://t.co/sFsPMhWMEt"

b"The film's amazing director @MatWhitecross was G,W, J & C's friend even before they were a band. He was filming them just hanging out from 1997. He was there to film the first rehearsal, and he's been filming them ever since. @Millerworld also got great stuff from 2000 on. PH https://t.co/MKGBGod5bq"

b"I love the early stuff from 1997-2000, when we were all so scruffy and innocent.  The X&Y studio footage is fascinating - especially as I wasn't there so I didn't see it firsthand. So many great scenes in the movie... I love all of it! PH https://t.co/e5VQfUI9AM"
b"I'd say it's only 25% concert footage. Most of it is story-telling.  The concert bits are very cool though because we filmed shows all around the world. PH https://t.co/CudY0QZyzL"

b"I'm in it WAY more than I wanted to be. But Mat said I was an important part of the story / overall vibe. I guess because the film is really about friendship, and how relationships evolve through a crazy shared experience. @daveholmesmgmt in it too - as the voice of reason! https://t.co/MsV8c55myo"

b"The band were amazingly relaxed.  I don't think they objected to anything.  Chris hasn't even seen the film (he explains why at the beginning of the movie).  We love Mat like a brother and we trust him 100%.  He's a brilliant director so why interfere? PH https://t.co/uF4oIhoej6"

b"AHFOD album / tour felt like the culmination and fulfilment of something. I guess that's why we put childhood photos of the five of us on the album cover: kids' crazy dreams coming true. The film is like a trampoline from one universe to the next... so much more to come! PH https://t.co/BS71xDm9xW"

b"Hola Argentina! Yes i've seen it many times now, at different stages of the edit.  Mat sent me the first cut around a year ago.  I was so impressed by how Mat wove it together.  He's got so much stylistic flair (he's half Argentinian!). The old footage from 1997-8 is crazy \xf0\x9f\x98\x82 PH https://t.co/eGkNYJTxjh"

b"It\xe2\x80\x99s 15 days until our A Head Full Of Dreams documentary reaches cinemas (a couple days before it arrives on #PrimeVideo). Does anyone have a question about the film? Going to make myself a cup of tea, then I'm here to answer your questions for a while! PH #AHFODfilm https://t.co/uK3z4sCkrT"
